ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Another issue...
ygData.msgSnippet: God Im glad I got DAoC as an alternative.. I am having tons of fun and havent been online in EQ for weeks and have not ordered SOL (So Out of LUCK?), but if DA
ygData.messageBody:
God Im glad I got DAoC as an alternative.. I am having tons of fun and
havent been online in EQ for weeks and have not ordered SOL (So Out of
LUCK?), but if DA get boring I proberly will be back.
Sofar DAoC have been perfect for my limited playtime.. It runs flawlessly on
my Athlon 600MHz with 256MB ram, SBlive and a 256Kbit ADSL connection.
Only way DAoC lacks in comparision to EQ is:
- Graphics they are a bit more dull than EQ IMO... Better in some ways, but
boring landscape and mobs..
Well they still update mob models. So there is hope :)
- Difficualty level. I fear that DA is too easy for my liking, but I guess
that only time will tell.

Musiker semi retired Minstrel on bertox
Musiker Midgaard Skald on Lancelot

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Christopher Sanders [mailto:christopher.sanders@...]
> Sent: 5. december 2001 15:17
> To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Another issue...
>
>
> I would assume dx8.1. I installed it, no problem.
>
> My first impression, I'm really disappointed, overall. I now
> hate the way I
> look...and I see no way to change that, guess it's back to
> the old models
> for me, and I so wanted to see everyone on horses. :(
>
> I hate the bard animations. Like someone said before, way
> too fast. Still
> strumming the drum, too. I really, really, *REALLY* hate
> that when I sit, I
> sit on my knees like a prim little princess...I'm *very*
> ticked about that.
> I see most everyone else does as well...it's fine for the female
> models...but the male models really do need the indian style
> sit model back.
>
> According to specs, my machine is sufficient to load most of
> the new models
> (15, so it says), as well as the new, hi-res textures. Well,
> I hope they
> make some improvements, or some system tweaks come out, because it was
> borderline unplayable, when I went with the recommended
> setup. Perhaps I
> just need to defrag my hard drive...don't know, but nothing
> else performs
> that badly. I actually had times when I was turning, and
> everything would
> stop for 7-10 seconds.
>
> Load times...load times are rotten, horrid, and unacceptable.
> No need to
> set /afk anymore, just hit a zone line...you've got plenty of
> time to go to
> the bathroom and freshen your drink. When I went to quit,
> from /camp to
> character select literally took 4 or 5 minutes. Not seemed
> like. Took.
>
> My system? 1.0 Ghz, 256 MB Ram, Geforce 256 DDR, SB Live
> Xgamer, are the
> important parts.
>
> Ok, maybe I do have to tweak my system. I believe I still have my TnL
> disabled, so I'll try that, as well as playing with the settings and
> defragging...so I'll admit, it could be me...but we'll see.
>
> I haven't been to Luclin yet. As soon as I realized my songs
> were messed, I
> just logged. It took me from 6pm to 11:30pm to patch.
>
> It can only get better from here...
>
> Atonal
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Nygaard, Jeff [mailto:jeff.nygaard@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2001 8:51 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Another issue...
>
>
> So, which one is it? Do I need directx8.0 or directx8.1? I
> still do not have
> SoL yet, but I should have it by weeks end, BUT I want to log
> onto EQ to
> check and see if Dain has spawned in Icewell Keep. I've been
> waiting for
> over a week now to see this short little sob and he has yet
> to show his
> face. I need him to spawn to complete my 9th Coldain Ring
> quest. On my way
> out to work this morning I was going to see if Dain was up,
> so I tried to
> log in real fast, but I couldn't get the patch to start. I
> didn't have any
> time to play EQ last night. Yesterday at work, I tore myself
> away from my
> work and emailed to my home address DirectX8 and my newest
> sound and video
> drivers. I just need to install them now.
>
> Ok, so now for my question, is the reason I couldn't log on
> this morning
> because I have not downloaded DirectX yet? If so, which
> DirectX do I need
> 8.0 or 8.1?
>
> Thanks for the help! My gnome warrior thanks you also!
>
> Sistily
>
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Talies the Wanderer [SMTP:snicker@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, December 05, 2001 7:37 AM
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Another issue...
>
> At 06:25 AM 12/5/2001 -0500, you wrote:
> >Well there has to be a date where things change.
> 12/03 and 12/04
> was the
> >date.
>
> No, what I meant was that he made the EXACT statement
> on the third
> that DX
> 8.0 was still supported, then less than 24 hours
> changed his words
> without
> explanation.
>
> I feel bad for anyone who prepurchased a SOL paperweight.
>
> Talies the Wanderer
>
>
